official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a credit for increases in the worker retraining expenditures of employers.
short_title: Tax Credit for Worker Retraining Act of 1996

summary.text: Tax Credit for Worker Retraining Act of 1996 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to establish a worker retraining increase credit for an employer equal to the excess (if any) of: (1) the qualified worker retraining expenses incurred by the employer for a year; over (2) the average of such expenses incurred by the employer in each of the three preceding years. Provides that in no event shall the amount determined under clause (2) be treated as less than 50 percent of the amount determined under clause (1).
